title: Medical assistance in dying will not increase health care costs in Canada

title_detail.value: Medical assistance in dying will not increase health care costs in Canada

summary: Providing medical assistance in dying to people in Canada will not increase health care costs, and could reduce spending by between $34.7 and $138.8 million, according to a new research paper. The savings exceed the $1.5 million to $14.8 million in direct costs associated with implementing medical assistance in dying.
